title: Myanmar’s Rebels See Possibility of Victory
description: Rebel fighters have handed Myanmar’s army defeat after defeat, for the first time raising the possibility that the military junta could be at risk of collapse.

title: Israeli Weapon Damaged Iranian Air Defenses Without Being Detected, Officials Say
description: The strike, two Western officials said, was calculated to deliver a message to Iran that Israel could bypass Iran’s defense systems undetected and paralyze them.

title: Why the War in Myanmar Matters
description: A devastating, yearslong civil war is heating up, but it still hasn’t attracted broad international notice.

title: Do Tanks Have a Place in 21st-Century Warfare?
description: As explosive drones gain battlefield prominence, even the mighty U.S. Abrams tank is increasingly vulnerable.

title: Takeaways From Our Chinese Swimming Investigation
description: A doping case involving Olympic swimmers has left unanswered questions and raised new concerns about the actions of a global antidoping regulator.

title: A Bill to Limit Canada’s Trade Negotiators on Farm Goods Edges Nearer to Law
description: The measure from a member of the Bloc Québécois would ban changes to the supply management system for dairy, poultry and eggs.

title: Top Chinese Swimmers Tested Positive for Banned Drug, Then Won Olympic Gold
description: The case, involving multiple swimmers who seven months later won medals at the 2021 Games, prompted accusations of a cover-up and concerns over why antidoping regulators chose not to intervene.

title: The Crookie Delights Paris
description: Stéphane Louvard married one of his signature croissants with a chocolate chip cookie to come up with the “crookie.” After a slow start, his creation took off after it became a TikTok phenomenon.

title: Israel Strikes an Iranian Military Base, but Damage Appears Limited
description: The drone attack may have been launched from inside Iran, once again demonstrating Israel’s ability to carry out clandestine operations there.

title: Israel’s Strike Was Smaller Than Expected, and So Was Iran’s Reaction
description: The relatively limited scope of the attack, as well as a muted response from Iranian officials, may have lowered the chances of an immediate escalation, analysts said.

title: U.S. Military to Withdraw Troops From Niger
description: The status of a $110 million air base in the desert remains unclear as the West African country deepens its ties with Russia.

title: Arrests of Europeans for Aiding Russia Raise Fears of Kremlin’s Reach
description: A string of arrests, including two Poles accused of attacking a Navalny aide and a third for ties to a possible plot against Ukraine’s president, have amplified worries of Russian infiltration.

title: Bedtime Stories for Grown-Ups
description: For those past the age of a parental tuck-in, audiobooks might provide a soothing analogue.

title: House Set to Vote on Foreign Aid Bills for Ukraine, Israel and Taiwan
description: After clearing a critical hurdle on Friday, the pieces of the $95 billion package were expected to pass in a series of votes, putting the legislation on track for enactment after a tortured journey through Congress.

title: Israel’s Strike on Iran: A Limited Attack but a Potentially Big Signal
description: Israel hit a strategic city with carefully measured force, but made the point that it could strike at a center of Iran’s nuclear program.

title: At G7 Meeting in Capri, Blinken Tackles Rough Seas and Global Crises
description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken and his counterparts, who met on the Italian island of Capri, welcomed signs that tensions between Iran and Israel might not worsen.

title: Israel Launched Missiles as Well as Drones at Iran, Officials Say
description: Though it was not immediately clear if the missiles struck targets inside Iran, their use would mean more sophisticated firepower was involved in the attack than first reported.

title: Battle of the Beaches: Greece Has New Plan to Keep Its Coasts Pristine
description: The government has pledged to crack down on rapid development, and on seaside businesses seeking to take advantage of a tourist boom. But some residents and conservationists are unimpressed.

title: Scotland Made Big Climate Pledges. Now They’re ‘Out of Reach.’
description: Despite significant progress, Scotland was falling short on cutting vehicle emissions, switching to heat pumps and even restoring peatland, the government said.

title: How France Is Fighting ‘Shrinkflation’
description: Merchants will be required to put signs in front of all products that have been reduced in size without a corresponding price cut.

title: Ukrainians Wait, Nervously, to See if U.S. Will Provide Critical Aid
description: From the battlefield to battered cities, soldiers and civilians are counting on Congress to approve $60 billion in military support. Without it, Ukrainian officials say, prospects in the war are grim.

title: Chinese Export Surge Clouds U.S. Hopes of a Domestic Solar Boom
description: The decision by a Massachusetts solar company to abandon plans to build a $1.4 billion U.S. factory highlights the risks amid a flood of Chinese clean energy exports.

title: Why Don’t More People Resent Manchester City?
description: Out of the Champions League but on top of the Premier League, Manchester City shows that it takes more than trophies to make a villain.

title: Iran-Israel Shadow War Timeline: A History of Recent Hostilities
description: A recent round of strikes has brought the conflict more clearly into the open and raised fears of a broader war.

title: Drones Believed to Have Been Used in Iran Attack Are a Common Israeli Weapon
description: Iranian officials said that an attack Friday used small drones possibly launched from inside Iran, and that radar systems had not detected unidentified aircraft entering Iranian airspace.

title: Worried About Trump’s Support for Ukraine, Eastern Europe Tries Outreach
description: A gathering of officials from Lithuania and Ukraine and supporters of Donald J. Trump highlights growing efforts to get on the good side of the former U.S. president in case he is elected again.

title: Turkey Earthquake Trial Opens Amid Anger and Tears
description: More than 300 people were killed when temblors toppled an upscale residential complex. Survivors hope a court will punish the men who built it.

title: Forbidden to Watch Films as a Child, He Now Directs Somalia’s Top Shows
description: Abshir Rageh had to sneak out from home to see bootleg Indian films and “Rambo” at a makeshift cinema. Now, he’s creating dramas that draw millions of online views in a country inching toward stability.

title: What We Know About Israel’s Strike in Iran
description: Israel struck Iran early Friday, according to officials from both countries, in what appeared to be its first military response to the Iranian attack on Israel last weekend.

title: Isfahan Is Home to Iranian Missile and Nuclear Facilities
description: Missiles are produced near the city, which also has nuclear research centers.

title: The Magnetic Heart of the Milky Way
description: A new map of the center of the Milky Way galaxy reveals details of its magnetic fields

title: Why India’s Opposition Can’t Get It Together
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s party got less than 40% of the vote in the last election. But his fractured and dysfunctional rivals have struggled to capitalize on that.

title: Reaction to Israel’s Strike in Iran Plays Down Significance
description: In Israel, officials described the strike as a limited response and reports from both sides suggested it did not appear to cause significant damage to military sites.

title: What I Learned From an Act of Violence in Sydney That Hit Too Close to Home
description: Amid early tidbits of misinformation came lessons about dodging falsities and allowing facts to build a story.

title: Friday Briefing
description: Israel strikes Iran.

title: Modi’s Power Keeps Growing, and India Looks Sure to Give Him More
description: Few doubt the popular prime minister will win a third term in voting that starts Friday. His strong hand is just what many Indians seem to want.

title: Apple Says It Was Ordered to Pull WhatsApp From China App Store
description: Apple said it removed WhatsApp and Threads from its China app offerings Friday on Beijing’s orders, amid technological tensions between the U.S. and China.

title: U.S. and Allies Penalize Iran for Striking Israel, and Try to Avert War
description: While imposing sanctions on Iran, U.S. and European governments are urging restraint amid fears of a cycle of escalation as Israel weighs retaliation for an Iranian attack.

title: U.S. Vetoes Palestinian Bid to Be Full U.N. Member State
description: The move blocked a resolution to support a status that Palestinians had long sought at the United Nations, where it is considered a “nonmember observer state.”

title: Friday Briefing: India’s Election Begins
description: Also, new Western sanctions on Iran, and China’s sinking cities.

title: C.I.A. Director Blames Hamas for Stalled Cease-Fire Talks
description: The group’s rejection of a recent proposal “is standing in the way of innocent civilians in Gaza getting humanitarian relief,” the director said.

title: Nicola Sturgeon’s Husband Charged in Embezzlement Case in Scotland
description: Peter Murrell was charged in connection with embezzlement of funds from the Scottish National Party, which his wife once led and where he held a senior role.

title: U.S. Restarts Deportation Flights to Haiti
description: The Biden administration had paused deportations of Haitian migrants in recent months as their home country was wracked by violence.

title: South Africa’s 2024 National Election: What to Know
description: The ruling African National Congress party could lose its parliamentary majority for the first time since the fall of apartheid 30 years ago.

title: Dubai’s Extraordinary Flooding: Here’s What to Know
description: Images of a saturated desert metropolis startled the world, prompting talk of cloud seeding, climate change and designing cities for intensified weather.

title: Satellite Data Reveals Sinking Risk for China’s Cities
description: Development and groundwater pumping are causing land subsidence and heightening the risks of sea level rise.

title: Land Under B.L.M. Management to Get New Protections
description: The measure elevates conservation in a number of ways, including by creating new leases for the restoration of degraded areas.

title: Scotland Pauses Gender Medications for Minors
description: The change followed a sweeping review by England’s National Health Service that found “remarkably weak” evidence for youth gender treatments.

title: Amsterdam’s Latest Effort to Fight Excessive Tourism: No New Hotels
description: The city wants no more than 20 million hotel stays annually. The measure is one of multiple efforts to control the flow of visitors.

title: Chinese Exports Are Threatening Biden’s Industrial Agenda
description: The president is increasingly hitting back with tariffs and other measures meant to restrict imports, raising tensions with Beijing.

title: How Israel’s Conflicts Could Escalate
description: Israel’s military is dealing with clashes with Hezbollah in Lebanon and with Iran, as well as the continuing war in Gaza.

title: Prince Harry Now Officially Resident in U.S., Documents Show
description: For years, Harry and his wife, Meghan, have considered California home. This week, he updated his residency in a corporate filing.

title: Qatar Says It Is Reviewing Its Mediator Role as Israel-Hamas Talks Stall
description: U.S. and Israeli officials have urged the Gulf state to exert more pressure on the Palestinian armed group to reach a deal.

title: Millions of Girls in Africa Will Miss HPV Shots After Merck Production Problem
description: The company has told countries that it can supply only 18.8 million of the 29.6 million doses it was contracted to deliver this year.

title: Croatia’s Election Result Makes a Far-Right Party a Possible Kingmaker
description: The Homeland Movement came third in parliamentary elections, setting itself up as a possible partner for the ruling conservatives, who failed to achieve a majority.

title: Germany Arrests 2 Men Suspected of Spying for Russia
description: The two men, dual citizens of both countries, were accused of being part of a plot to undermine aid to Ukraine by trying to blow up military infrastructure.

title: Rainstorms Kill More Than 130 in Afghanistan and Pakistan
description: Pakistani officials warned of more flooding and heavy rainfall next week, stoking fears of a particularly brutal monsoon season to come.

title: After Months of Cocaine Washing Ashore, Australian Police Make an Arrest
description: Drug parcels kept showing up on beaches along Australia’s shoreline. Now, the police say they found the man behind the botched shipment.

title: W.H.O. Broadens Definition of Airborne Diseases
description: After a drawn-out global controversy over the coronavirus, the W.H.O. has updated its classification of how pathogens spread through the air.

title: Drought Pushes Millions Into ‘Acute Hunger’ in Southern Africa
description: The disaster, intensified by El Niño, is devastating communities across several countries, killing crops and livestock and sending food prices soaring.
